snippet: Budget cuts for federal public defenders are gutting the constitutional right to counsel.
abstract: Editorial warns budget cuts for federal public defenders, part of across-the-board cuts known as sequestration, are gutting constitutional right to counsel; notes prime example of this is request by lawyers of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, indigent defendant accused of providing material support for terrorism, to have his trial postponed because their resources have been cut.
lead_paragraph: Budget cuts for federal public defenders are gutting the constitutional right to counsel.
